A powerful alternative to freeware task scheduling software for Windows

Streamline and simplify cross-platform job scheduling with ActiveBatch by Redwood, a true workload automation alternative to Windows Task Scheduler.

Get a Demo

Choose advanced task scheduling automation

Leave the frustrations of limited scheduling options and time-consuming manual setup behind ‚Äî Drive efficient process orchestration across any environment with automated scheduler features.

Ready for complex environments

Unlike most task management software, ActiveBatch allows workloads to run on any operating system, including Windows, Mac OS, Linux, UNIX, OpenVMS and more.

A drag-and-drop interface

The Integrated Jobs Library provides your automation team members with hundreds of pre-built job steps that make it easy to develop reliable, cross-platform workflows.

Adaptable to your scheduling needs

ActiveBatch proactively monitors workflow progress and will auto-remediate any workflow that overruns, underruns, displays exit codes, fails or puts SLAs at risk.

Escape the limitations of freeware

Free task schedulers lack key features businesses require as they grow into more complex and multi-platform environments. Freeware task schedulers are limited by:
  • Single-platform support
  • Limited or no technical support
  • A lack of event-based triggers
  • High-touch manual coding requirements
  • Lack of monitoring/auditing tools and notifications
  • An inability to work collaboratively
  • Subpar security features and permissions
 Automate in Half the Time

Adopt a sophisticated system scheduler

ActiveBatch reduces delays, minimizes slack time and improves SLAs while allowing you to run as many jobs as you need based on a wide variety of event types, including:
  • Email
  • FTP file event triggers and batch files
  • Message queues
  • Database modifications
  • Execution machine reboots
  • Windows startups
  • Tweets
 Explore Modern Task Scheduling

Task scheduler FAQs

Is there a better alternative to Task Scheduler?

Delivering increased productivity, visibility and scalability while relying on custom scripting, manual processes and free versions with no support is challenging at best.

Learn more about the benefits of using a Windows Task Scheduler alternative.
What is the difference between a job scheduler and task scheduler?

A task scheduler is primarily focused on scheduling individual programs or scripts to run at specific times on a single machine.

Enterprise-grade workload automation tools like ActiveBatch, sometimes referred to as "job schedulers,‚Äù manage complex workflows across different systems with advanced features like dependency management and monitoring.

Read more about enterprise job scheduling software.
What is the best task scheduler?

There are many types of job scheduler tools on the market today. IT organizations should consider the tools in their tech stack and their requirements when selecting the right tools for their specific jobs. In-product and basic job scheduling tools like Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler or Cron can be used by organizations that are just starting to automate, but they often need to be completely replaced later on.

A workload automation platform is needed for more complex environments or cross-application workflows. These solutions offer a more robust set of features, including monitoring, built-in templates, variables and job steps for faster workflow development, as well as a connector library to integrate the platform with different tools in the tech stack.

Some of the best enterprise job scheduler tools available include:

  • ActiveBatch by Redwood
  • RunMyJobs by Redwood
  • Tidal by Redwood
